H0.text: The Dardanelles and the Bosporus, straits which separate Europe from the mainland of Asia, run through which country. Greece

H1.text: The Dardanelles and the Bosporus, straits which separate Europe from the mainland of Asia, run through which country. Bulgaria

H2.text: The Dardanelles and the Bosporus, straits which separate Europe from the mainland of Asia, run through which country. Russia

H3.text: The Dardanelles and the Bosporus, straits which separate Europe from the mainland of Asia, run through which country. Turky

A4.text: Multiple bridges and tunnels connect Asian and European sides of Turkey; the Ã‡anakkale 1915 Bridge on the Dardanelles strait is the longest suspension bridge in the world. Marmaray and Eurasia tunnels under the Bosporus connect both sides of Istanbul.

A5.text: With Turkish straits and Sea of Marmara in between, Turkey bridges Western Asia and Southeastern Europe.

A6.text: The Bosporus is a natural strait located in Turkey.

A7.text: The Dardanelles Strait is part of the Turkish Straits.
